FuncDef:
The clock source cesacr synchronization command configures clock source synchronization for the CES ACR clock recovery domain.
The undo clock source cesacr synchronization command deletes configured clock source synchronization from the CES ACR clock recovery domain.
By default, no clock source synchronization is configured for the CES ACR clock recovery domain.
CLIs: clock source cesacr slot <slotid> card <cardid> recovery-domain <domain-value> synchronization enable
undo clock source cesacr slot <slotid> card <cardid> recovery-domain <domain-value> synchronization enable

ParaDef.Info:
Subcard ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Number of the clock recovery domain from which a clock source is extracted.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8.
The value ranges from 1 to 4 of the 16 E1 subcard.The value of the former 16 interfaces of the 32 E1 subcard ranges from 1 to 4, and of the latter 16 interfaces ranges from 5 to 8.

Slot ID of a board.
The value is a string of 1 to 16, not case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] clock source cesacr slot 0 card 1 recovery-domain 1 synchronization enable
[~HUAWEI] clock source cesacr slot 1 card 1 recovery-domain 1 synchronization enable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The clock source cesacr synchronization command configures the clock source of a CES ACR recovery domain to participate in system clock source selection.
Prerequisites
Before configuring clock source synchronization for the CES ACR clock recovery domain, you must configure the clock recovery domain for an E1 or a CPOS interface, and specify the configured domain as the system reference clock source.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
